sen.j: 福知山駅（ふくちやまえき）は、京都府福知山市にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）・北近畿タンゴ鉄道（KTR）の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture, Fukuchiyama Station is a stop of West Japan Railway Company (JR West) and Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation (KTR).
Located in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture, Fukuchiyama Station is a station owned by West Japan Railway Company (JR West) and Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation (KTR).
Located in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture, Fukuchiyama Station is a station owned by West Japan Railway Company (JR West) and Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation (KTR).

sen.j: 北近畿の鉄道網の中心駅である。
sen.e: It is a main station of the railway system in Kita (northern)-Kinki.
It is a major station of the northern (kita) Kinki railway system.
It is a major station of the northern (kita) Kinki railway system.

sen.j: 北近畿最大の福知山都市圏に位置する。
sen.e: The station is located in the Fukuchiyama metropolitan area which is the largest metropolitan area in northern Kinki.
The station is located in the Fukuchiyama metropolitan area, the largest metropolitan area in northern Kinki.
The station is located in the Fukuchiyama metropolitan area, the largest metropolitan area in northern Kinki.

sen.j: この駅より北近畿の各方面へ路線が広がる。
sen.e: Railway lines expand from this station to each direction in northern Kinki.
It is the starting point for lines to all destinations in northern Kinki.
It is the starting point for lines to all destinations in northern Kinki.

sen.e: Available railway lines
Lines

tit.e: Station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West) station
West Japan Railway Company (JR West) station

sen.j: 京都府福知山市天田談畑262番地
sen.e: 262 Amata [Amada] Danbata, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture
262 Amata [Amada] Danbata, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture
262 Amata [Amada] Danbata, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 2005年11月26日に高架化された。
sen.e: The station was remodeled as an elevated station on November 26, 2005.
The station was remodeled as an elevated station on November 26, 2005.
The station was remodeled as an elevated station on November 26, 2005.

sen.j: 島式2面・単式1面の合計3面5線のホームを持ち、1番線からは旧福知山駅の一部を眺める事ができる。
sen.e: It has two island platforms, both sides of which are used for boarding and exiting trains, another platform, only one side of which is used for boarding and exiting, and 5 railway tracks in total, and a part of the old Fukuchiyama Station can be seen from Platform 1.
It has two island platforms and one side platform serving a total of 5 tracks, with part of the old Fukuchiyama Station being visible from Platform 1.
sen.cmt: Deleted explanation of platform types."and a part"→"with part""can be seen"→"being visible"
sen.e: It has two island platforms and one side platform serving a total of 5 tracks, with part of the old Fukuchiyama Station being visible from Platform 1.

sen.j: ※北口側から1番のりば→5番のりばで、5番のりばのみ単式。
sen.e: * Platform 1 is located in the farthest north, followed by Platform 2 to 5 to the south, and Platform 5 is the single platform, only one side of which is used for boarding and exiting.
* Platform 1 is located closest to the North Entrance, followed by Platforms 2 to 5 to the south, with Platform 5 being the side platform.
sen.cmt: "in the farthest north"→"closest to the North Entrance"Made "Platforms" plural
sen.e: * Platform 1 is located closest to the North Entrance, followed by Platforms 2 to 5 to the south, with Platform 5 being the side platform.

sen.j: ※1･2番ホームの長さは230m。
sen.e: * The length of Platform 1 and 2 is 230 m.
* The length of Platform 1 and 2 is 230 m.
* The length of Platform 1 and 2 is 230 m.

sen.j: （荷物車を含めると最大12両編成になる寝台列車「出雲_(列車)」が収まるようにするため。
sen.e: (This is long enough for Overnight train service "(Sunrise) Izumo," which can have up to 12 cars including freight cars, to fit in the platforms.
(This was long enough to accommodate the overnight train "(Sunrise) Izumo," which could have up to 12 cars including freight cars.
sen.cmt: In light of the following sentence, changed verbs to past tense."to fit in the platforms"→"to accomodate"
sen.e: (This was long enough to accommodate the overnight train '(Sunrise) Izumo,' which could have up to 12 cars including freight cars.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせて"を'に

sen.j: なお、寝台特急「出雲」は2006年3月18日に廃止）
sen.e: Incidentally, Overnight train service "(Sunrise) Izumo" was discontinued on March 18, 2006.
However, this service was discontinued on March 18, 2006.
However, this service was discontinued on March 18, 2006.

sen.j: 福知山駅は、西日本旅客鉄道福知山支社が北近畿への観光PRとして提唱する「北近畿ビッグXネットワーク」の中心（福知山駅がアルファベットのXの真ん中に当たる）となっており、乗り継ぎ料金制度など特急同士の乗り継ぎをシームレスに行える配慮がなされている。
sen.e: Fukuchiyama Station is the hub station of the North Kinki Big X Network (the cross point of Letter X represents Fukuchiyama Station), which is publicized as a promotion of tourism in northern Kinki by Fukuchiyama Branch Office of West Japan Railway Company, and thus some special ideas, including the connection train fare system, in which passengers can change Limited Express trains seamlessly, are being executed.

Fukuchiyama Station is the hub station of the 'North Kinki Big X Network' (the cross point of the letter X represents Fukuchiyama Station), which is being publicized by the Fukuchiyama Branch Office of West Japan Railway Company to promote tourism in northern Kinki and, therefore, schemes such as the connection train fare system, which allows passengers to change Limited Express trains smoothly, are being considered.
sen.cmt: Added inverted commasAdded "the"Added "being""a promotion of"→"to promote""some special ideas"→"schemes such as""executed"→"considered""in which passengers can change Limited Express trains seamlessly→"which allows passengers to change Limited Express trains smoothly"
sen.e: Fukuchiyama Station is the hub station of the 'North Kinki Big X Network' (the cross point of the letter X represents Fukuchiyama Station), which is being publicized by the Fukuchiyama Branch Office of West Japan Railway Company to promote tourism in northern Kinki and, therefore, schemes such as the connection train fare system, which allows passengers to change Limited Express trains smoothly, are being considered.

sen.j: 高架化と同時に、駅全体の広さは大幅に広くなり、駅の出口は高架化前の出口である北口と南口の2つとなった。
sen.e: At the same time the station building was elevated, the size of the entire station was expanded substantially, and two exits, the north exit that used to be the only exit before elevated and the south exit, are now available.

At the same time that the station building was elevated, the size of the entire station was expanded substantially, and two exits, the north exit that used to be the only exit before elevation and the south exit, are now available.

At the same time that the station building was elevated, the size of the entire station was expanded substantially, and two exits, the north exit that used to be the only exit before elevation and the south exit, are now available.

sen.j: またエスカレータとエレベーターが設置された。
sen.e: Additionally, escalators and elevators have been set up.
Additionally, escalators and elevators were installed.
Additionally, escalators and elevators were installed.

sen.j: しかし、改札口は高架化前と同じく自動改札機はないままである。
sen.e: However, no automatic ticket checkers have not been installed as before it was elevated.
However, as before evelation, there are no automatic ticket gates.
sen.cmt: Deleted "no""have not been"→"there are no""it was elevated"→"elevation"
sen.e: However, as before elevation, there are no automatic ticket gates.

sen.j: 1階南北コンコース横（西側）にテナントスペース「ビエラ福知山」がある。
sen.e: A tenancy space, Vierra Fukuchiyama, is located next to (on the western side of) the north-south concourse.
A tenancy space, Vierra Fukuchiyama, is located on the ground floor of the western side of the north-south concourse.
A tenancy space, Vierra Fukuchiyama, is located on the ground floor of the western side of the north-south concourse.

sen.j: 待合室、トイレがあり、店舗ではcafe北都（カフェ）、福島文進堂福知山駅店（書店）、ブレ・グラーノ（イートインベーカリー）、餃子の王将（中華料理店）、京都銀行・京都北都信用金庫（銀行現金自動預け払い機）、日本旅行(Tis)、デイリーイン（コンビニエンスストア）がある。
sen.e: The station has a waiting room, bathrooms and stores including cafe Hokuto (coffee shop), Fukushima Bunshindo (book store), Ble Grano (eat-in bakery), Gyoza no Ohsho (Chinese restaurant), automated teller machines of the Bank of Kyoto and Kyoto Hokuto Shinkin Bank, Nippon Travel Agency Co.,Ltd (Tis), and Daily-in (convenience store).

The station has a waiting room, toilets and stores including 'cafe Hokuto' (coffee shop), 'Fukushima Bunshindo' (book store), 'Ble Grano' (eat-in bakery), 'Gyoza no Ohsho' (Chinese restaurant), Bank of Kyoto and Kyoto Hokuto Shinkin Bank ATMs, 'Nippon Travel Agency Co.,Ltd' (Tis), and 'Daily-in' (convenience store).
sen.cmt: "bathrooms"→"toilets""automated teller machines of the"→"ATMs"Added inverted commas to shop names
sen.e: The station has a waiting room, toilets and stores including cafe Hokuto (coffee shop), Fukushima Bunshindo (book store), Ble Grano (eat-in bakery), Gyoza no Ohsho (Chinese restaurant), Bank of Kyoto and Kyoto Hokuto Shinkin Bank ATMs, Nippon Travel Agency Co., Ltd (Tis), and Daily-in (convenience store).
sen.cmt: 原文に「」のない' 'を削除スペース挿入

sen.j: なお、比較的閉店は早い（しかし「餃子の王将」は000まで開いている）。
sen.e: Most of the stores close a store relatively early (but Gyoza no Ohsho is open until midnight).
Most of the stores close relatively early (though Gyoza no Ohsho is open until midnight).
Most of the stores close relatively early (though Gyoza no Ohsho is open until midnight).

sen.j: しかしながら、改札内は数台の飲料自動販売機があるだけになり、菓子や新聞などが買えなくなってしまい、駅弁や名物だった「鬼そば」も高架化で姿を消した。
sen.e: However, after the station was elevated, stores disappeared inside the ticket wicket and only a few beverage vending machines are now available, and thus no other items, such as snack and newspaper, are available and Ekiben (lunch boxes available at some stations and on some trains) and Oni Soba noodle, which used to be its specialty, are no longer sold.
sen.cmt: 駅弁はEkiben (lunch boxes available at some stations and on some trains)と、翻訳者が解説を入れました。
sen.e: However, past the ticket gate there are now only a few beverage vending machines, and thus no other items, such as snacks and newspapers, are available and Ekiben (lunch boxes available at some stations and on some trains) and Oni Soba noodles, which used to be its specialty, are no longer sold.
sen.cmt: Reworded first part of sentenceMoved "disappeared"Made "snack","newspaper" and "noodle" plural
sen.e: However, past the ticket gate there are now only a few beverage vending machines, and thus no other items, such as snacks and newspapers, are available and Ekiben (lunch boxes available at some stations and on some trains) and Oni Soba noodles, which used to be its specialty, are no longer sold.

sen.j: なお、ホームのすべての時計に描かれているのは、福知山市のイメージキャラクター「ドッコちゃん」である。
sen.e: A picture drawn in all of the clocks on the platforms is "Dokko-chan," the image character of Fukuchiyama City.
All the clocks on the platforms are decorated with "Dokko-chan," the mascot of Fukuchiyama City.
sen.cmt: Deleted "A picture drawn in" and "of"Added "are decorated with""image character"→"mascot"
sen.e: All the clocks on the platforms are decorated with 'Dokko-chan,' the mascot of Fukuchiyama City.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせて"を'に

sen.j: BGMとして小鳥のさえずりが流されるようになった。
sen.e: Twittering of a little bird is now adopted as BGM.
The BGM is now birds singing.
The BGM is now birds singing.

sen.j: 京都方面への列車が1・2番のりばに固定されている点と、5番のりばが福知山線の快速・普通列車専用となっている点以外は、発着ホームの変動が大きい。
sen.e: Trains for Kyoto are always arrive at and start from Platform 1 or 2, and similarly, Rapid and Local trains that run on the Fukuchiyama Line always arrive at and start from Platform 5; however, from which platform other trains leave and at which platform other trains arrive are not really determined.

Trains for Kyoto are always arrive at and start from Platforms 1 or 2 and Rapid and Local trains that run on the Fukuchiyama Line always arrive at and start from Platform 5; however, the platforms for other trains are not really determined.
sen.cmt: Made "Platform" plural"from which platform other trains leave and at which platform other trains arrive"→"the platforms for other trains"
sen.e: Trains for Kyoto always arrive at and depart from Platform 1 or 2 and Rapid and Local trains that run on the Fukuchiyama Line always arrive at and start from Platform 5; however, the platforms for other trains are not really determined.
sen.cmt: 文法間違い。 - “are always arrive ”=>”always arrive”"start" -> "depart" に変更しました。

sen.j: また、北近畿タンゴ鉄道の列車の一部もJR線ホーム発着のため、注意が必要である。
sen.e: Passengers need to pay attention to information on arriving and starting platforms as some trains of Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation also use platforms originally intended for JR trains.
Passengers need to pay attention to information on arriving and starting platforms as some Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation trains also use the JR platforms.
sen.cmt: Moved "trains"Added "the JR"Deleted "originally intended for JR trains"
sen.e: Passengers need to pay attention on arriving and departuring platforms as some Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation trains also use the JR platforms.

sen.j: 豊岡方面への普通列車については、1・2番のりばに発着して京都方面の普通列車との対面乗換を可能とすることが多いが、2008年3月15日のダイヤ改正以降、京都方面と豊岡方面の普通列車の相互接続がないケースもあり、日中も豊岡方面行き普通列車が3・4番のりばに入るケースが多々見られるようになった。
sen.e: Local trains for Toyooka often arrive at or start from Platform 1 or 2 so that passengers can change trains for Kyoto on the same platform (without using stairway to other platforms); however, since the timetable was revised on March 15, 2008, there are many Local trains that have no interconnection with trains between for Kyoto and for Toyooka, and accordingly, there are now quite a few Local trains for Toyooka that use Platform 3 or 4 even in the daytime.

Local trains for Toyooka often arrive at or start from Platform 1 or 2 so that passengers can change trains for Kyoto on the same platform; however, since the timetable was revised on March 15, 2008, not many local trains for Kyoto or Toyooka connect, and a lot of the local trains for Toyooka now use Platform 3 or 4 even in the daytime.
sen.cmt: Deleted phrase in brackets"there are"→"not many" Reworded last part of sentence
sen.e: Local trains for Toyooka often arrive at or depart from Platform 1 or 2 so that passengers can change trains for Kyoto on the same platform; however, since the timetable was revised on March 15, 2008, not many local trains for Kyoto or Toyooka connect, and a lot of the local trains for Toyooka now use Platform 3 or 4 even in the daytime.

sen.j: 特急列車については、豊岡方面からの列車と宮津方面からの列車が1・2番のりばで、逆に豊岡方面行きと宮津方面行きが3・4番のりばで相互に乗り換えられるようダイヤ面で考慮されている。
sen.e: Regarding Limited Express trains, the train diagram is carefully designed so that passengers of the train from Toyooka and those form Miyazu can change trains at Platform 1 and 2 mutually, and similarly, passengers of the train for Toyooka and those for Miyazu can change trains at Platform 3 and 4 mutually, using the same platform (without using stairway to other platforms) for both cases.

The timetable for Limited Express trains is carefully designed so that trains from Toyooka and trains from Miyazu stop at Platforms 1 and 2 and trains for Toyooka and trains for Miyazu stop at Platforms 3 and 4 mutually, allowing passengers to change trains on the same platform.
sen.cmt: "Regarding Limited Express trains, the train diagram"→"The timetable for Limited Express trains"Reworded sentence
sen.e: The timetable for Limited Express trains is carefully designed so that trains from Toyooka and trains from Miyazu stop at Platform 1 and 2 and trains for Toyooka and trains for Miyazu stop at Platform 3 and 4 respectively, allowing passengers to change trains on the same platform.

tit.j: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道（KTR宮福線）の駅
tit.e: Station of Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation (KTR Miyafuku Line)
Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation (KTR Miyafuku Line) station
Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation (KTR Miyafuku Line) station

sen.j: 京都府福知山市天田118番地の4
sen.e: 118-4 Amata [Amada], Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture
118-4 Amata [Amada], Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture
118-4 Amata [Amada], Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 現在はまだ地平ホームで営業をしており、1面2線のホームを持つ。
sen.e: Services are still operated on a platform, both sides of which are used for boarding and exiting, at ground level.
The station still uses one ground level island platform serving two tracks.
The station still uses one ground level island platform serving two tracks.

sen.j: 将来はこちらも高架化される予定である。
sen.e: This station is planned to be elevated in the future as well.
This station is planned to be elevated in the future as well.
This station is planned to be elevated in the future as well.

sen.j: 尚、JR相互乗入れの特急電車はJR高架駅での乗降となっている（前述の通り、特急以外にもJR高架駅に発着する列車が少数ながら存在する）。
sen.e: Passengers who take Limited Express trains entering the JR tracks are supposed to use the JR elevated station (as mentioned earlier, there are also a few trains that use the JR elevated station, other than the Limited Express trains).
Limited Express trains sharing the JR tracks use the JR elevated station for boarding and alighting (as mentioned above, some non-Limited Express trains also use the JR elevated station).
Limited Express trains sharing the JR tracks use the JR elevated station for boarding and alighting (as mentioned above, some non-Limited Express trains also use the JR elevated station).

sen.j: 余談であるが、現在のKTRのホームはかつての北丹鉄道の福知山駅があった位置にあたる。
sen.e: Incidentally, the present platform of KTR is located where Fukuchiyama Station of old Hokutan Railway used to be located.
Incidentally, the present KTR platform is located where the old Hokutan Railway's Fukuchiyama Station used to be located.
Incidentally, the present KTR platform is located where the old Hokutan Railway's Fukuchiyama Station used to be located.

sen.j: JR高架駅からはJR旧駅構内に設けられた北口への横断仮設通路により連絡。
sen.e: A temporary pass connects between the JR elevated station and the north exit which is set up in the old station yard of JR.
A temporary pass connects the north exit, which is in the grounds of the old JR station, with the JR elevated station.
A temporary pass connects the north exit, which is in the grounds of the old JR station, with the JR elevated station.

sen.j: JR旧駅撤去の後、引き続き高架化工事にかかり、一体化する。
sen.e: The exit will be integrated with the elevated station by continuing the elevating construction after the old JR station building is dismantled.
The KTR station will be integrated with the elevated JR station by continuing the elevating construction after the old JR station building is demolished.
The KTR station will be integrated with the elevated JR station by continuing the elevating construction after the old JR station building is demolished.

sen.j: 高架駅は、2008年(平成20年)度の末に完成予定である。
sen.e: The elevated station is scheduled to be completed at the end of 2008.
The elevated KTR station is scheduled to be completed at the end of 2008.
The elevated KTR station is scheduled to be completed at the end of fiscal year 2008.

sen.j: 1996年まで180万人台で推移していたが、その後減少に転じ2006年では約146万人となっている。
sen.e: Although the number remained at a level of 1.8 million's up to 1996; however, it started decreasing after that and was about 1.46 million in 2006.
Numbers were around the 1.8 million mark until 1996 when they started decreasing, reaching about 1.46 million passengers in 2006.

sen.e: Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation:

sen.j: 1996年に48万人とピークを示したが、その後は40万人前後で推移しており、2006年は約29万人となっている。
sen.e: The number peaked at 480,000 passengers in 1996 and remained stable around the 400,000 level after that, and it was 290,000 passengers in 2006.
Numbers peaked at 480,000 passengers in 1996 and remained around the 400,000 level after that, with 290,000 passengers in 2006.
Numbers peaked at 480,000 passengers in 1996 and remained around the 400,000 level after that, with 290,000 passengers in 2006.

sen.j: 駅周辺
sen.e: Periphery of the station
Surroundings
Surroundings

sen.j: 駅南側は福知山駅南口公園として整備された。
sen.e: The area in the south of the station has been developed as Fukuchiyama Station Minamiguchi Park (Fukuchiyama Station South exit Park).
The area to the south of the station has been developed as Fukuchiyama Station Minamiguchi Park (Fukuchiyama Station South exit Park).
The area to the south of the station has been developed as Fukuchiyama Station Minamiguchi Park (Fukuchiyama Station South exit Park).

sen.j: 公園に接してタクシー乗り場、高速バスの発着場がある。
sen.e: A taxi stand and a coach station are located next to the park.
A taxi stand and a coach station are located next to the park.
A taxi stand and a coach station are located next to the park.

sen.j: 公園前に福知山温泉をひいたビジネスホテルが建設された。
sen.e: A budget hotel to which hot water is brought from Fukuchiyama Onsen has been built in front of the park.
A budget hotel, which draws hot water from Fukuchiyama Onsen, has been built in front of the park.
sen.cmt: "to which hot water is brought"→"which draws hot water from Fukuchiyama Onsen"
sen.e: A budget hotel, which draws hot water from Fukuchiyama Onsen, has been built in front of the park.

sen.j: 国道9号線沿いにコンビニエンスストア、マクドナルド、吉野家、壱番屋、TSUTAYAなど全国展開の店も多くなってきている。
sen.e: The number of stores whose business is expanded throughout Japan, including convenience stores, McDonald's, Yoshinoya, Curry House CoCo Ichibanya and TSUTAYA, has been increasing along National Highway 9.
sen.cmt: 社名の後の「Co., Ltd」などは、あくまでも社名であり、店自体の呼び名ではないため、省くか、別の言い方がある場合はそちらを採用いたしました。
sen.e: The number of national chains, including convenience stores, McDonald's, Yoshinoya, Curry House CoCo Ichibanya and TSUTAYA, has been increasing along National Highway 9.
sen.cmt: "stores whose business is expanded throughout Japan"→"national chains"

sen.e: Several around-the-clock convenience stores, such as Lawson and Seven-Eleven, are located in the areas in both the north and south of the station.

sen.j: 福知山駅から、京都交通バス川北線・丹後海陸交通バス（丹海バス）傘松ケーブル下（籠神社・一の宮乗船場前）及び、共栄高校前行きで、「西本町」下車、または、徒歩。
sen.e: Take a bus of Kawakita Route, Kyoto Kotsu Bus or Tango Kairiku Kotsu Bus (Tankai Bus) to Kasamatsu Cable-shita (bus stop) (Kono-jinja Ichinomiya Josenjo-mae) and Kyoei-koko-mae (bus stop) from Fukuchiyama Station, and leave the bus at Nishi-hommachi (bus stop), or walk.

From Fukuchiyama Station, take the Kyoto Kotsu Bus Kawakita Route or the Tango Kairiku Kotsu Bus (Tankai Bus) for Kasamatsu Cable-shita (Kono-jinja/ Ichinomiya Josenjo-mae) or for Kyoei-koko-mae (Kyoei High School bus stop), to Nishi-hommachi (bus stop), or walk.

sen.j: 福知山の鉄道に関わる実物（ライブスチームの模型や鉄道模型もあり）及び資料を展示。
sen.e: It displays real objects (including steam locomotive models that actually run with steam engine and model trains) and materials related to railway of Fukuchiyama.
It displays relia (including steam locomotive models that actually run on steam and model railways) and materials related to railway of Fukuchiyama.
sen.cmt: "real objects"→"relia""with steam engine and model trains"→"on steam and model railways"
sen.e: It displays relia (including steam locomotive models that in fact run on steam and model railways) and materials related to railway of Fukuchiyama.

sen.j: ポッポランドオリジナル及び福知山の名産品・鉄道関係の土産を扱う売店もある。
sen.e: It also has a shop that sells its original goods, and Fukuchiyama's specialties and souvenirs related to railway.

sen.e: It also has a shop that sells original goods, Fukuchiyama's specialties and souvenirs related to railway.
It also has a shop that sells original goods, Fukuchiyama's specialties and souvenirs related to railway.

sen.j: 2号館では、実際に福知山を走った、国鉄C58形蒸気機関車の56号機が静態保存展示されている。
sen.e: In the No.2 building, a JNR steam locomotive C58 class, model No. 56, which has actually run in Fukuchiyama City, is stored and displayed statically.
In the No.2 building, the JNR C58 Class steam locomotive, model No. 56, which used to run in Fukuchiyama City, is stored and displayed.
In the No.2 building, the JNR C58 Class steam locomotive, model No. 56, which used to run in Fukuchiyama City, is stored and displayed.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1904年（明治37年）11月3日 - 日本国有鉄道の駅として開業（当駅～東舞鶴駅間の開通と同時）。
sen.e: November 3, 1904: Started as a station of Japan National Railways (JNR) (at the same time as the section between Fukuchiyama Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station was opened to traffic).
November 3, 1904: Opened as station of Japan National Railways (JNR) (at the same time, section between Fukuchiyama Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station opened).
sen.cmt: "Started"→"Opened"Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese.
sen.e: November 3, 1904: Opened as station of Japan National Railways (JNR) (at the same time, section between Fukuchiyama Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station opened).

sen.j: 同時に阪鶴鉄道福知駅～当駅間が開通。
sen.e: At the same time, the section between Fukuchi Station of Hankaku Railway and this station was opened to traffic.
At the same time, section between Hankaku Railway's Fukuchi Station and this station opened to traffic.
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese.
sen.e: At the same time, section between Hankaku Railway's Fukuchi Station and this station opened to traffic.

sen.j: 客貨取扱を開始。
sen.e: Passenger and freight services started.
Passenger and freight services started.
Passenger and freight services started.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）8月1日 - 阪鶴鉄道が国有化。
sen.e: August 1, 1907: Hankaku Railway was nationalized.
August 1, 1907: Hankaku Railway nationalized.
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese
sen.e: August 1, 1907: Hankaku Railway nationalized.

sen.j: 1923年（大正12年）9月22日 - 北丹鉄道線が開業。
sen.e: September 22, 1923: Hokutan Railway Line was opened to traffic.
September 22, 1923: Hokutan Railway Line opened.
sen.cmt: Deleted "to traffic"Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese.
sen.e: September 22, 1923: Hokutan Railway Line opened.

sen.j: 1971年（昭和46年）3月2日 - 北丹鉄道線が休止。
sen.e: March 2, 1971: Hokutan Railway Line halted its services.
March 2, 1971: Services suspended on Hokutan Railway Line halted its services.
sen.cmt: "halted its services"→"Services suspended"Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese
sen.e: March 2, 1971: Services suspended on Hokutan Railway Line.
1974: Hokutan Railway Line was discontinued.
1974: Hokutan Railway Line discontinued.
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese.
sen.e: 1974: Hokutan Railway Line discontinued.

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）11月1日 - 貨物取扱を廃止。
sen.e: November 1, 1986: Freight services were discontinued.
November 1, 1986: Freight services discontinued.
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese.
sen.e: November 1, 1986: Freight services discontinued.

sen.j: 貨物取扱施設福知山オフレールステーションを設置。
sen.e: Fukuchiyama Off-rail-station, a freight handling facility, was set up.
Fukuchiyama Off-rail-station freight handling facility set up.
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese.
sen.e: Fukuchiyama Off-rail-station freight handling facility set up.

sen.j: 福知山線全線と・山陰本線城崎温泉駅まで電化。
sen.e: The entire Fukuchiyama Line and the section of the San'in Main Line up to Kinosakionsen Station were electrified.
Entire Fukuchiyama Line and section of San'in Main Line up to Kinosakionsen Station electrified.
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese.
sen.e: Entire Fukuchiyama Line and section of Sanin Main Line up to Kinosakionsen Station electrified.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化によりJR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987: Became a station under the control of JR West with the division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987: Came under control of JR West following division and privatization of JNR.
sen.cmt: Added "following"Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese.
sen.e: April 1, 1987: Came under control of JR West following division and privatization of JNR.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）7月16日 - 宮福鉄道（現在の北近畿タンゴ鉄道）宮福線が開業。
sen.e: July 16, 1988: Miyafuku Line of Miyafuku Railway Company (current Kitakinki Tango Railway) was opened to traffic.
July 16, 1988: Miyafuku Line of Miyafuku Railway Company (current Kitakinki Tango Railway) opened.
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese.
sen.e: July 16, 1988: Miyafuku Line of Miyafuku Railway Company (current Kitakinki Tango Railway) opened.

sen.j: 1995年（平成7年）4月20日 - 綾部駅～福知山駅間が電化。
sen.e: April 20, 1995: The section between Ayabe Station and Fukuchiyama Station was electrified.
April 20, 1995: Section between Ayabe Station and Fukuchiyama Station electrified.
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese.
sen.e: April 20, 1995: Section between Ayabe Station and Fukuchiyama Station electrified.

sen.j: 2005年（平成17年）11月26日 - JR線の当駅付近が高架化。
sen.e: November 26, 2005: The JR lines around this station were elevated.
November 26, 2005: JR tracks around station elevated.
sen.cmt: "Lines"→"tracks"Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese.
sen.e: November 26, 2005: JR tracks around station elevated.

sen.j: 2008年度（平成20年度）末 - 北近畿タンゴ鉄道線の当駅付近が高架化予定。
sen.e: End of 2008: Lines of Kitakinki Tango Railway around this station will be elevated.
End of 2008: Kitakinki Tango Railway tracks around station to be elevated.
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, deleting articles, etc as in Japanese.
sen.e: End of fiscal year 2008: Kitakinki Tango Railway tracks around station to be elevated.
